title: High Prevalence of Anemia Among Pregnant Women
description: In 2019, 59% of pregnant women in Mali were affected by anemia, indicating a significant public health concern.

title: Low Political Stability and High Risk of Violence
description: As of 2023, Mali ranks very low in political stability with a percentile rank of 2.84, highlighting ongoing challenges in governance and security.

title: Limited Female Autonomy in Health Decisions
description: In 2018, only 5.3% of women aged 15-49 in Mali made their own informed decisions regarding sexual and reproductive health.

title: High Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2018, 68.5% of women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for arguing, and 62.8% for refusing sex, reflecting deep-rooted societal norms.

title: Low Proportion of Older Female Population
description: In 2023, only 2.41% of the female population in Mali were aged 50-54, and 1.38% were aged 60-64, indicating a younger demographic profile.
